Description: Three studies of the head of a fish Watercolour
Curator's comments: The amateur artist Adanson served as French Consul in Egypt from 1775 until 1785 and recorded many natural and historical curiosities of the country in sketches and watercolours. After his return to France, there was a plan to publish his drawings and this highly-finished study may be associated with that project in the 1790s. In the end, the plans came to nothing.
Acquisition notes: The drawing was formerly in an anonymous French collection and was one of 151 Adanson studies offered at sale in Paris in 1958. It then entered another anonymous collection, which was sold at Christie's, London, 16 July 1963, where it formed part of lot 36 and was sold to Sven Gahlin. This item has an uncertain or incomplete provenance for the years 1933-45. The British Museum welcomes information and assistance in the investigation and clarification of the provenance of all works during that era.
